Guide.title: Login to TriSys CRM
Guide.html: Please login by entering your email address.

Guide.title: Password
Guide.html: Enter your password.

Guide.title: Remember Credentials
Guide.html: Enable automatic login to TriSys when you return to this page.

Guide.title: Login Button
Guide.html: Press this login button to submit and authenticate your credentials.

Guide.title: Forgot Password
Guide.html: If you have forgotten your password, please click this link to receive an e-mail link to reset your password.

Guide.title: Sign-Up
Guide.html: If you do not have an account, please click this link to register for a new account.

Guide.title: Social Logins
Guide.html: If you have associated your login with a social network, you can login to your account using the appropriate button.

Guide.title: Forgotten Password E-Mail
Guide.html: If you are a subscriber, and have a valid e-mail address but forgotten your password, you should enter your e-mail address here.

Guide.title: Submit Forgotten Password Request
Guide.html: Press this button to submit your e-mail address to our service and receive an automated e-mail allowing you to reset your password.

Guide.title: Sign-Up / Registration
Guide.html: If you wish to become a subscriber, and provision your own TriSys cloud database, please enter your details into this form.

Guide.title: Social Network Login
Guide.html: If you have a social network login, you can login using the appropriate button and pre-fill some fields in this form.

Guide.title: Social Network Details
Guide.html: If you logged in with a social network, your name and photo will be displayed here.

Guide.title: Contact Details
Guide.html: Your personal and company contact details must be entered here.

Guide.title: Login Credentials
Guide.html: You must complete the e-mail address and password fields if you did not login with a social network.

Guide.title: Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy
Guide.html: You must agree to the terms and conditions of this service, and our privacy policy before submitting your registration.

Guide.title: Company
Guide.html: You must complete your company address details for invoicing purposes.

Guide.title: Register
Guide.html: After pressing this button you will submit your credentials to our provisioning system which will direct you to our payment gateway.

Guide.title: Contact Us Form
Guide.html: If you wish to contact us, please complete this form so that we can contact you as soon as possible.

Guide.title: Name
Guide.html: Please enter your full name i.e. first name and last name.

Guide.title: Company
Guide.html: Please enter your company name.

Guide.title: E-Mail
Guide.html: Please enter your e-mail address.

Guide.title: Phone
Guide.html: Please enter your preferred phone number.

Guide.title: Message
Guide.html: Please enter your message. Please enter as much detail as you can as this will help us direct your query to the relevant team.

Guide.title: Submit
Guide.html: After pressing this button you will receive an automated e-mail confirming your request for us to contact you.

Guide.title: Welcome to TriSys Apex
Guide.html: Are you ready to take a quick tour of this application?

HelpInvocationFunctionExplanation: To allow us to reset the DOM to what we want so that the introJS can know that the DOM elements will not change

Guide.title: Welcome to TriSys Recruitment Software
htmlList: TriSys Apex Recruitment CRM Software is specifically designed to help you achieve your goals,
enabling you to automate your recruitment business processes.
The 'Welcome' screen allows you to get started with TriSys and configure important areas of the application.
Click 'Next' to continue your visual application tour.

Guide.title: Show/Hide Menu Bar
htmlList: Use this button to show the navigation menu or minimise the navigation menu.
The navigation menu is displayed on the left hand side of this window and contains several menus and submenus.
The navigation menu can also be used after it is minimised, allowing you to optimise your screen usage.

Guide.title: Quick Find
htmlList: Quickly locate and open any database record by typing in this text box and pressing the 'Return' key on your keyboard.
This will display a drop down list matching the top matching contacts, companies, requirements and placements.
Selecting the appropriate result/record will open the corresponding record/form for editing.

Hint: you may use the '%' symbol to perform a wildcard search.

For example where your quick lookup does not return results you could type any of the following:

'Forename %'
'% Middle Name %'
'% Surname'

You may also use the '%' symbol to lookup contacts, companies, requirements, placements and timesheets via a wildcard search, for example '%S% will find the first/top database records containing the letter %S% (this is purely an example as you will normally always type more than a single letter into the quick lookup field however TriSys allows you to be as vague or as precise as you wish.'

Guide.title: Your Recent Navigation History
htmlList: Every time you view a record in TriSys, the record is added to the 'History' menu.
This menu allows you to quickly load a previously displayed database record.
This saves you considerable time, and offers a single-click intuitive navigation experience.

Guide.title: Add New Record
Guide.html:
Use this menu to quickly add the following database records:

Candidates
Clients
Companies
Requirements
Placements
Timesheets
Notes & Histories
Scheduled Tasks
Post-It Notes

You may also send 'Post-It' notes to one or more TriSys users, allowing you to message other TriSys users, enhancing your team collaboration.

Guide.title: Activate Show Help
htmlList: The integrated Help system is always available to assist you in getting the best from TriSys.
Simply click this button and the contextual Help system will guide you through the functionality of the current form.
You can also enable Help by pressing the F1 key on your keyboard.

Guide.title: Decrease Font Size
Guide.html: Allows you to decrease font sizes. You can also use your web browser 'Zoom' buttons.

Guide.title: Increase Font Size
Guide.html: Allows you to increase font sizes. You can also use your web browser 'Zoom' buttons.

Guide.title: Welcome Screen, User Options & Logoff
Guide.html:
This area allows you to configure your user options and also securely close your TriSys session when using TriSys on a shared machine.

Use this area to open your user or company record, configure your user contact details, configure e-mail sending, configure e-mail and diary synchronisation, choose application colour theme, configure grid settings, configure job board posting settings and more.

Guide.title: CRM - Customer Relationship Management
htmlList: The CRM navigation menu allows you to access key functionality of the TriSys database.
<dd>Any type of contact: client, candidate or user.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">A company can have multiple contacts and addresses.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">A requirement is a vacancy or a job order. It is linked to a client company and contact.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">A placement is a filled job. It is linked to a client company, client contact and candidate contact.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">A timesheet is completed by a candidate and authorised by your client contact.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">CV's or Resumes can be imported to create candidate records using our integrated CV parser.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">All actions you undertake will diarise follow-ups to ensure you conduct business efficiently.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">Chat with your colleagues and share important information quickly.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">All of your key performance indicators can be graphically represented in the dashboard.</dd>
<dd style="padding-top: 5px;">Dozens of pre-built management information reports are conveniently located in one place.</dd>

Guide.title: Marketing Campaigns
htmlList: Create e-mail templates, mass mail your contact database and track delivery and click analytics.
Note: sending mass marketing mails using TriSys requires configuration of your e-mail service/server
to allow TriSys to send emails on your behalf.
This is called 'SMTP Relay' (your e-mail service provider will have publicly available instructions on how this is configured).
Alternatively, your current IT services provider will be able to assist.
Note that SMTP relay must be allowed from the IP address associated with the following host: api.trisys.co.uk (ping to resolve IP).
This service is optional and requires configuration/training. Please contact your TriSys account manager to request further information.

Guide.title: Saved Searches
Guide.html: Segment your database using saved searches, favourites and exclusions lists. Sophisticated boolean searches can be configured and saved using this area of the system.

Guide.title: Online Portals
Guide.html: Link your TriSys database to your website, candidate portal and client portal, ensuring a modern and fully integrated candidate job search and registration experiences as well as advanced self-service functionalities for your candidates and clients, anywhere and on any device.

Guide.title: Administration Area
Guide.html:
Available only to TriSys database administrators, this area allows managing skills/attributes, system settings, centralised documents, user security permissions, timesheet periods, import bulk data using a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet file and more.

Please note: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk. If in doubt about any configurations please do not make any changes and contact your TriSys account manager to discuss further.

Training videos are also available, please see the menu 'Help > Training Courses' for additional videos covering a wide range of relevant topics.

Guide.title: Help Area
Guide.html: Please use the 'Show Help' button located at the top of the TriSys application to display the Help system. Alternatively you may click this menu to load the 'Welcome' screen and also load a comprehensive video tutorials library.

Guide.title: Developer Tools
Guide.html: Available only for TriSys Apex Developers, the 'Developer' menu allows access to deep customisation of the TriSys platform.

Guide.title: Quick Stats Area
Guide.html: Displays information on a series of metrics linked to your specific TriSys User Account.

Guide.title: Thank You
Guide.html:
Thank you for completing the visual navigation overview.

Using TriSys Recruitment Software is extremely easy.

You are now invited to close this pop-up window and start using TriSys.

The 'Show Help' button above will be available for you to use at all times.

Guide.title: Locked Application
Guide.html: This application has been locked by the currently logged in user.

Guide.title: Enter Password
Guide.html: Enter your password and press <Enter> or the Unlock button in order to unlock the application.

Guide.title: Saved Searches
Guide.html:
Your previously saved searches are always automatically available here.



Saved searches are managed using the 'Searches' menu on main TriSys navigation bar.

Guide.title: Searching Contacts
Guide.html: Use this area to easily create simple and advanced boolean searches.

Guide.title: Configuring Your Search
Guide.html:
Select a field from the dropdown list, then input your search criteria.



Add fields/groups using the green buttons.



You may remove fields using the red buttons.



'AND' / 'OR' buttons allow you to easily control the boolean search logic.

Guide.title: Run Your Search
Guide.html:
Click here to run your search and load all matching records.

You may also clear your search criteria (this will reset your search and will load all your data).

Should you be looking for a specific database record, it is easier and faster to use the quick lookup field available at the top of this page.

Guide.title: Clear/Reset Search
Guide.html: Click here to clear any search criteria above. This will reset your search and will load all data.

Guide.title: Recruitment Dashboards
Guide.html:
Using drag and drop, TriSys Database Administrators can easily create a recruitment dashboard which will be displayed for all users.

The 'View' menu allows you to start your dashboard configuration/layout, add new dashboard tiles and more.

Should you be a TriSys database administrator user, you can configure the dashboard in greater depth (this is done using the 'Configure View' and 'View Manager' buttons, which can made visible using the 'Security' tab of your TriSys Administration Console (see 'Administration'' menu)

Description: A generic help sequence inserted into forms with .GridHelp = true

Guide.title: Grid Control & Actions Buttons
Guide.html: Easily run a variety of automated workflows against one or more selected database records.

Guide.title: Product Video Library #1 of 2
Guide.html: This page contains a series of multi-media video presentations about this product and service.

Guide.title: Product Video Library #2 of 2
Guide.html: Please click on the hyperlink associated with each video to launch.

Guide.title: Incoming CV's
Guide.html:
This area contains a list of all CV's ready to be parsed into your TriSys database as soon as you click each CV or click the 'Import' button next to each CV.

CV's can be added to this area and parsed at a later time/when convenient.

You may also use the TriSys Outlook add-in which allows adding CV's to the CV Auto-Recognition area directly from your Outlook inbox.

Guide.title: Add New CV
Guide.html:
Click here to upload a CV document into your TriSys database.

When you upload a CV, the contents of the CV will automatically be parsed.

You can upload CV's from your computer as well as a variety of popular cloud storage services.

If you are using Microsoft Outlook on Microsoft Windows, you can add CV's directly from within your inbox, using the TriSys Plugin for Microsoft Outlook, available for download at www.trisys.co.uk

Guide.title: Automated CV Import Area
Guide.html:
This tab displays the results of the automated CV parsing when you parse a CV using TriSys.

You are also able to parse CV files from within Microsoft Outlook. Simply install the TriSys Microsoft Outlook plugin (for Microsoft Windows) and automatically parse CV's from your inbox into TriSys.

Guide.title: Update Duplicate
Guide.html:
This tab is used to update existing candidate records using an updated version of their CV.

The contents of this tab are only displayed when one or more duplicate records are detected at the point of parsing a CV and you select a specific duplicate candidate record to update by clicking the 'Duplicates' button.

This button is located at the top right of the 'Candidate Details' area and will display any duplicate contact(s) found for the CV which is being parsed and allow you to selectively update an existing record instead of creating a duplicate record.

Guide.title: Save Changes
Guide.html: Click this button in order to save all changes made to the current database record.

Guide.title: Delete
Guide.html:
This will delete the record from your database (note that some records cannot be deleted due to other records having logical data relationships which prevent such deletions).

Warning: There is no 'undelete' functionality available (only backup restores which are available as an optional consultancy service).

Your TriSys Database Administrator User can hide this button on a per-user basis, using the Administrator Console > Security area.

Disclaimer: TriSys Business Software is not liable for data deleted by users.

Guide.title: Automated Actions Menu
Guide.html:
The 'Actions' menu is designed to enable the highest levels of productivity across your business.

The 'Actions' menu is always available on every TriSys database record, allowing you to log calls, add notes, schedule tasks, run mail merges and much more, always 100% ready to use and completely eliminating manual repetitive tasks.

Each of the individual tabs shown below will normally also contain an 'Actions' button which enables running automated workflows in relation to the data being displayed in the selected tab. This means automated Actions are 100% contextual to the area of the TriSys system you are viewing at any time.

Guide.title: Open LinkedIn
Guide.html:
Open the LinkedIn page for this contact (please use the TriSys Browser Extension for maximum productivity).

You may also open Facebook and Twitter pages for this contact.

Guide.title: Quick Contact Preview
Guide.html:
This button allows you to preview an editable contact record as a summary pop-up window.

This is an especially important button which is also available on all TriSys Contact Grids.

Guide.title: Contact Record
Guide.html:
In TriSys, all contacts share the same look and feel, therefore ensuring ease of use and consistency.

Contacts can be created via the TriSys CV Parsing system (CV Auto Recognition menu), the TriSys LinkedIn Browser Extension, the TriSys Outlook Add-In and Microsoft365 Add-In and also manually.

Contacts can also be imported from Excel spreadsheets.

To add or replace the contact photo, hover over the photo to reveal the image control buttons.

Guide.title: Job Title Management
Guide.html:
If the job title for the contact you are adding does not yet exist, simply type the job title on the box shown to the left of this button and click the 'Save' button (this will save this record and simultaneously add the new job title to your database).

Job Titles are managed using the 'Administration Console > Attributes/Lookups > Job Titles' (restricted to Database Administrator Users).

Guide.title: Personal
Guide.html:
This tab is used to store Candidate Information

When you parse a candidate CV using the CV Auto Recognition CRM Menu, this will automatically populate various fields in this tab.

You may also upload the Original and Formatted CV(s) directly from your computer/device should your work methodology include this workflow (however using the CV Auto Recognition menu will offer the greatest time savings for your team).

Guide.title: Original CV Field
Guide.html:
The original Candidate CV is stored in this field. This happens automatically when you add a CV to TriSys using the CV Auto Recognition CRM Menu.

Click the Open button to view the CV within TriSys Apex, using our advanced Word Editor technology.

To create a Formatted CV you simply click this button and choose Copy CV which will allow you to copy the Original CV into any of the four available Formatted CV fields.

Guide.title: Formatted CV Field(s)
Guide.html:
Once you have copied the Original CV to any Formatted CV field (four formatted CV's available as standard unless some of these hidden as a result of a system customisation) you can open the Formatted CV and edit the CV within TriSys Apex, using our advanced Word Editor technology.

When formatting a CV you may choose to add your company letterhead or instead TriSys will do this automatically for you when you send the candidate CV via the CV Send Action available both within a contact record/contact grids as well as within a Requirement Shortlist.

Guide.title: Employment
Guide.html:
This tab contains Client Contact information.

This tab also contains a link to the Company where the Client contact is employed.

For your convenience, this tab is automatically displayed for Client contacts.

Guide.title: Company Button/Menu
Guide.html:
Use this button/menu to Re-assign the Company to which the Contact is linked.

This button/menu also allows you to select the Company address/location for the Client (should the Company have multiple addresses/offices).

You can also use this button/menu to create a new Company and automatically link the Contact to the company (this means you can add a Contact and then create the Company for this contact, should the Company not already exist).

Guide.title: Attributes
Guide.html:
You can freely assign attributes/skills against any database records and then run Boolean Searches/Saved Searches where these Attributes/Skills are used as Boolean search criteria.

You will also notice that every database record contains a range of useful fields within the Attributes tab, where these fields are relevant to the specific type of database record you are viewing (such as a Contact, Company, Requirement, Placement and Timesheet).

Attributes and Lookups are managed using the Administrator Console.

Guide.title: Relationships
Guide.html: This tab allows you to create Relationships between related database records, a popular feature for networking and specific key information which helps your team in the process of specific decision-making.

Guide.title: Social
Guide.html:
Store links to various social networks for Contacts in your TriSys database.

Please use the TriSys Browser Extension for enhanced LinkedIn integration (the TriSys Browser Extension is fully compatible with Google Chrome and the new Microsoft Edge and streamlines your productivity by allowing automated LinkedIn contact import/update and much more, directly within LinkedIn contact records/web pages).

Guide.title: Back Office
Guide.html: Use this tab to store candidate payment details.

Guide.title: Requirements
Guide.html: All Requirements associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Guide.title: Placements
Guide.html: All Placements associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Guide.title: Timesheets
Guide.html:
All Timesheets associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Timesheets can be added manually by database users (open a Placement record and then add Timesheets to the Placement and/or use the online TriSys Candidate and Client Timesheet portals to automate your timesheet workflows).

Guide.title: Documents
Guide.html: Store various Documents associated with this database record.

Guide.title: Notes
Guide.html:
All Historical Notes are displayed within this tab.

Notes are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Tasks
Guide.html:
All Scheduled Tasks are displayed within this tab.

Tasks are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Privacy/GDPR
Guide.html:
TriSys offers enhanced Privacy/GDPR management for your Clients and Candidates.

Privacy/GDPR fields available within this tab are editable by Candidates and Clients using the TriSys Candidate and Client self-service online portals, powered by the TriSys Web API.

Guide.title: View (Open) LinkedIn Page (or Search contact on LinkedIn)
Guide.html:
Open the LinkedIn page for this contact (please use the TriSys Browser Extension for maximum productivity).

or click the Facebook and Twitter icons to open the social network profiles for this contact.

Guide.title: Company Record
Guide.html:
A Company record represents a real-world business or organisation.

Click here to add/upload a company logo (if a logo is already in place, you can remove/replace the logo using the Attributes tab below).

Guide.title: Save Changes
Guide.html: Click this button in order to save all changes made to the current database record.

Guide.title: Delete
Guide.html:
This will delete the record from your database (note that some records cannot be deleted due to other records having logical data relationships which prevent such deletions).

Warning: There is no 'undelete' functionality available (only backup restores which are available as an optional consultancy service).

Your TriSys Database Administrator User can hide this button on a per-user basis, using the Administrator Console > Security area.

Guide.title: Addresses and Contacts
Guide.html: All contacts employed at the company are visible within this tab (this will also include candidates who are placed with the company, where you may use the Contact Type colour-coded grid field to differentiate between Client and Candidate records).

Guide.title: Company Addresses and Contacts Grid
Guide.html:
All company contacts (including Clients and also Placed Candidates) are displayed here.

Use the Contacts and Addresses menus to add/remove contacts and add/edit/remove addresses.

The Grid menu allows you to toggle grid filtering, grid grouping and configure additional grid preferences.

The Actions menu allows you to run action workflows against one or more selected contacts.

Guide.title: Addresses and Contacts
Guide.html: The Organogram tab is used to visually map hierarchical relationships.

Guide.title: Attributes
Guide.html:
You can freely assign attributes/skills against any database records and then run Boolean Searches/Saved Searches where these Attributes/Skills are used as Boolean search criteria.

You will also notice that every database record contains a range of useful fields within the Attributes tab, where these fields are relevant to the specific type of database record you are viewing (such as a Contact, Company, Requirement, Placement and Timesheet).

Guide.title: Relationships
Guide.html: This tab allows you to create Relationships between related database records, a popular feature for networking and specific key information which helps your team in the process of specific decision-making.

Guide.title: Back Office
Guide.html: Use this tab to store company Bank details.

Guide.title: Requirements
Guide.html: All Requirements associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Guide.title: Placements
Guide.html: All Placements associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Guide.title: Documents
Guide.html: Store various Documents associated with this database record.

Guide.title: Notes
Guide.html:
All Historical Notes are displayed within this tab.

Notes are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Tasks
Guide.html:
All Scheduled Tasks are displayed within this tab.

Tasks are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Requirement / Vacancy Record
Guide.html:
TriSys allows you to create requirements/vacancies of the following types:

Permanent
Contract
Temporary

Once you select the requirement type, configure the corresponding salary/rate cards and proceed to the 'Search' tab to create your boolean searches.

You will then be able to review & shortlist candidates as well as carry out a range of sophisticated business operations using automated, template-driven recruitment actions including:

Add to Shortlist
CV Send
Interview
Interested
Meeting
Mail Merge
Offer Accepted
Offer Rejected
Send Job Specification
Placement

 Many more automated workflows are available, fully integrated with your e-mail and calendar.

When you run specific action workflows, these will automatically generate e-mail messages which you can fully review/edit before sending. TriSys will also automatically schedule follow-ups in your diary, ensuring you are always focussed on what matters, whilst TriSys automated everything else for you.

Guide.title: Actions Menu
Guide.html:
The 'Actions' menu is designed to enable the highest levels of productivity across your business.

The 'Actions' menu is always available on every TriSys database record, allowing you to log calls, add notes, schedule tasks, run mail merges and much more, always 100% ready to use and completely eliminating manual repetitive tasks.

Each of the individual tabs shown below will normally also contain an 'Actions' button which enables running automated workflows in relation to the data being displayed in the selected tab. This means automated Actions are 100% contextual to the area of the TriSys system you are viewing at any time.

Guide.title: Pay and Charge Rate Configuration
Guide.html:
Configure Salary, Fees and more for this Requirement record.

You can create any number of Placements from a Requirement record, where each Placement will allow you to configure the applicable/relevant Salary for the Placement.

Guide.title: Permanent Salary Configuration
Guide.html:
Configure pay and charge rate information for this Requirement record.

You can create any number of Placements from a Requirement record, where each Placement will allow you to configure the applicable/relevant Salary for the Placement.

Guide.title: Boolean Searching
Guide.html: Create simple and advanced Boolean searches or simply load existing saved searches.

Guide.title: Search Results
Guide.html:
This area displays all contacts matching your search criteria, offering streamlined contact and CV preview functionality and more.

To shortlist one of more candidates, select one or more contacts and run the Add to Shortlist Action

Guide.title: Candidate Shortlist
Guide.html:
This is where you can run fully automated Shortlist Actions and track the individual progress of each candidate.

The following actions are available for shortlisted candidates:

CV Send
Interview
Interested
Meeting
Mail Merge
Offer Accepted
Offer Rejected
Send Job Specification
Placement

Many more automated workflows are available, fully integrated with your e-mail and calendar.

Guide.title: Shortlist Grid
Guide.html:
Displays all shortlisted candidates for this Requirement record.

Show/hide any columns, readjust the order of columns, track individual candidate progress, import applicants from job boards and run automated Action workflows using the Actions menu/button.

Guide.title: Rejected
Guide.html:
All candidates rejected using the Shortlist Reject button are visible here.

You can un-reject any candidate by selecting a candidate and clicking the Remove button.

Candidates who are rejected using the ShortlistReject **Action** remain visible in the Shortlist tab and stamped with a Date Rejected value.

Guide.title: Attributes
Guide.html:
You can freely assign attributes/skills against any database records and then run Boolean Searches/Saved Searches where these Attributes/Skills are used as Boolean search criteria.

You will also notice that every database record contains a range of useful fields within the Attributes tab, where these fields are relevant to the specific type of database record you are viewing (such as a Contact, Company, Requirement, Placement and Timesheet).

Attributes and Lookups are managed using the Administrator Console.

Guide.title: Placements
Guide.html: All Placements associated with this database record are displayed within this tab.

Guide.title: Documents
Guide.html: Store various Documents associated with this database record.

Guide.title: Notes
Guide.html:
All Historical Notes are displayed within this tab.

Notes are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Tasks
Guide.html:
All Scheduled Tasks are displayed within this tab.

Tasks are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: View Agency Web Portal
Guide.html:
Should your TriSys subscription include the Candidate Web Portal, this button will open the web portal.

Using the Candidate Web Portal, candidates can register directly on your database, login and update their preferences, apply to live vacancies, submit timesheets and much more.

There is also a Client Web Portal available as an optional service.

The Web Portals are comprehensive solutions designed to automate and streamline candidate and client workflows and deliver innovative self-service experiences.

The Web Portals can also be fully branded for your business.

Guide.title: Placement Record
Guide.html:
Placement records can be of type:

Permanent
Contract
Temporary

Placements of type Contact or Temporary allow you to:

- Add/Edit/Delete the Placement Rates by selecting a rate and using the buttons located at the top right of the 'Contract/Temp Pay and Charge Rates' area

- Select the timesheet authoriser(s) using the Back Office tab and using the control buttons available at the top right of the 'Line Managers' grid

- Add/Edit timesheets (use the Add > Timesheet menu visible at the very top of the TriSys application window).

The Documents, Notes and Tasks tabs work exactly as with all other TriSys database records.

In a Placement, use the Actions menu located at the top right in order to run Placement workflow actions including the fully automated generation of Placement Contract Documentation.

Guide.title: Save Changes
Guide.html: Click this button in order to save all changes made to the current database record.

Guide.title: Delete
Guide.html:
This will delete the record from your database (note that some records cannot be deleted due to other records having logical data relationships which prevent such deletions).

Warning: There is no 'undelete' functionality available (only backup restores which are available as an optional consultancy service).

Your TriSys Database Administrator User can hide this button on a per-user basis, using the Administrator Console > Security area.

Disclaimer: TriSys Business Software is not liable for data deleted by users.

The 'Actions' menu is designed to enable the highest levels of productivity across your business.

The 'Actions' menu is always available on every TriSys database record, allowing you to log calls, add notes, schedule tasks, run mail merges and much more, always 100% ready to use and completely eliminating manual repetitive tasks.

Each of the individual tabs shown below will normally also contain an 'Actions' button which enables running automated workflows in relation to the data being displayed in the selected tab. This means automated Actions are 100% contextual to the area of the TriSys system you are viewing at any time.

Guide.title: Pay and Charge Rate Configuration
Guide.html: Configure pay and charge rate information for this Placement record.

Guide.title: Permanent Salary Configuration
Guide.html:

You can create any number of Placements from a Requirement record, where each Placement will allow you to configure the applicable/relevant Salary for the Placement.

Guide.title: Back Office
Guide.html:
Timesheet Frequency

Define the frequency for timesheets which are added against this placement.

Line Managers

Configure Line Managers/Timesheet Authorisers.

Guide.title: Timesheets
Guide.html: View Placement timesheets (applicable to Placements of Type Temporary/Contract) whether added manually by your team/users or by candidates/clients (using the TriSys Online Timesheet Portal for Candidates and Clients).

Guide.title: Documents
Guide.html: Store various Documents associated with this database record.

Guide.title: Notes
Guide.html:
All Historical Notes are displayed within this tab.

Notes are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Tasks
Guide.html:
All Scheduled Tasks are displayed within this tab.

Tasks are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Timesheet Record
Guide.html:
Timesheets are available for Contract and Temporary placements.

Timesheet hours, pay and charge rates as well as a range of additional timesheet information is available at any time in a timesheet record.

Timesheets can be added manually or alternatively using the online TriSys Candidate and Client Web Portals (should these be included in your current TriSys subscription).

Guide.title: Save Changes
Guide.html:
Click this button in order to save all changes made to the current database record.

Note: already authorised timesheets cannot be edited/saved (run the 'Un-Authorise Payment' action where an already authorised timesheet requires editing, make your edits and then run the 'Authorise Payment' action)

Guide.title: Delete
Guide.html:
This will delete the record from your database (note that some records cannot be deleted due to other records having logical data relationships which prevent such deletions).

Warning: There is no 'undelete' functionality available (only backup restores which are available as an optional consultancy service).

Your TriSys Database Administrator User can hide this button on a per-user basis, using the Administrator Console > Security area.

Disclaimer: TriSys Business Software is not liable for data deleted by users.

Guide.title: Automated Actions Menu
Guide.html:
Use the Actions menu to authorise a timesheet, un-authorise a timesheet, export a timesheet to Payroll and more.

Note: when you run the Authorise Payment action (or the timesheet is authorised by the Client via the TriSys Timesheet Portal) the timesheet becomes read-only and cannot be edited (except where a permissioned user runs the 'Un-Authorise Payment' action.

Disclaimer: TriSys Business Software is not liable for the incorrect usage of Timesheet records.

Guide.title: Attach Original Timesheet
Guide.html:
Attach the original timesheet supplied by the Candidate or by the Client.

The atached timesheet can be viewed by the Client and Candidate should you wish to allow this visibility.

Guide.title: Timesheet Hours
Guide.html:
Input timesheet hours by clicking the fields below and typing the total hours worked across all the applicable timesheet days/hours/rates.

Please note: timesheets which have been authorised (by the Client, via the online TriSys Client Timesheet Portal OR manually, by a TriSys user, via the Authorise Payment Action) are no longer editable (unless you run the Un-Authorise Timesheet Action.

Timesheet Pay and Charge totals are automatically calculated for your convenience.

Guide.title: Attributes
Guide.html:
You can freely assign attributes/skills against any database records and then run Boolean Searches/Saved Searches where these Attributes/Skills are used as Boolean search criteria.

You will also notice that every database record contains a range of useful fields within the Attributes tab, where these fields are relevant to the specific type of database record you are viewing (such as a Contact, Company, Requirement, Placement and Timesheet).

Attributes and Lookups are managed using the Administrator Console.

Guide.title: Documents
Guide.html: Store various Documents associated with this database record.

Guide.title: Notes
Guide.html:
All Historical Notes are displayed within this tab.

Notes are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Tasks
Guide.html:
All Scheduled Tasks are displayed within this tab.

Tasks are created manually as well as automatically, when you run Actions

Guide.title: Timesheet Hours
Guide.html:
Should your company be using the TriSys Online Timesheet Portal for Candidates and Clients, the total hours worked will be automatically displayed in the Timesheet Hours Grid.

You may edit the timesheet hours below up until the moment when the candidate requests timesheet approval using the online Timesheet portal (please also read the information below).



Should your company not yet be using the TriSys Online Timesheet Portal for Candidates and Clients, you can input the timesheet hours manually by clicking and typing the total hours worked within each Period/Rate applicable to this timesheet (click to edit). You may then authorise the timesheet on behalf of the Client, by running the Authorise Payment action, at which point the timesheet will no longer be editable (you may also run the Un-Authorise Payment should you wish to un-authorise an already authorised timesheet, for the purpose of editing the timesheet hours where required before re-running the Authorise Payment Action).

Guide.title: Integrated Diary Manager
Guide.html:
Use the Add > ToDo menu or run any action which has the Scheduled Task setting enabled.

Click a task to view its content, follow-up, clear or delete a task.

You can also integrate your diary with TriSys (this is done under your User Options > Security configuration).

Guide.title: Add New Scheduled Task
Guide.html:
Use the Add menu to add a new scheduled task.

Alternatively run the ToDo action in any database record or data grid.

Guide.title: Manage Timesheet Periods
Guide.html:
Configure Timesheet Periods for Contract and Temporary recruitment operations.

Timesheet Periods must be configured in order to allow Users and/or Candidates to add new Timesheets against Placements.

Should you ever see a notification message 'Timesheet Periods Expired' this means you must configure/add timesheet periods using this area of your database.

Guide.title: Choose Timesheet Frequency
Guide.html: Choose the relevant timesheet frequency or frequencies as required by your organisation.

Guide.title: Configure New Timesheet Periods
Guide.html: Configure and Add timesheet periods as required by your organisation.

Guide.title: Timesheet Periods Grid
Guide.html:
Displays information on all available timesheet periods.

Once you have selected the Frequency and configured Add Periods as shown above, click the Add button located above to add/create the timesheet periods and corresponding timesheet intervals

Guide.title: Timesheet Period Intervals Grid
Guide.html: Displays information on all available timesheet period intervals for the selected timesheet period (as selected using the Periods grid).

Guide.title: Chat Menu
Guide.html: This menu allows you to delete all messages from a chat session, add/remove users to your chat area.

Guide.title: Chat Window
Guide.html: Select a contact and start chatting. You can send/receive messages, documents and links to any TriSys database records using the fully integrated Chat system.

Guide.title: Saved Contact Searches
Guide.html:
Maintain your own list of saved searches. Each search can have its own search criteria and list of favourite contacts. Saved searches can be re-used in other forms to quickly retrieve records for business workflow purposes.

Shared Searches - The User(s) combo field allows you to view Saved Searches created by other users in the company.

Guide.title: Search
Guide.html: When an existing search has been selected, this tab displays the search criteria and the grid of resulting records.

Guide.title: Favourites
Guide.html: This tab is where a list of favourite contact records is displayed in a grid.

Guide.title: User(s)
Guide.html: By default, your name is shown here allowing you to see your own searches, however you can choose any other users to view their searches and re-use or clone them.

Guide.title: Add Search
Guide.html:
Add a new search by opening a popup dialogue where you can give it a unique and descriptive name allowing easy re-use elsewhere in the application.

When you add a new saved search you will automatically be taken into the 'Search' tab (where you can build your search criteria using the familiar and easy to use TriSys Apex search experience).

Guide.title: Clone Search
Guide.html: Take a copy of the selected search, including the search criteria, and assign it a date and timestamped name. The search results grid will then be automatically refreshed, showing the newly cloned search ready for editing or searching.

Guide.title: Edit Search
Guide.html: Open the selected search for editing by opening a popup dialogue where you can change the unique name and description allowing easy re-use elsewhere in the application.

Guide.title: Delete Search
Guide.html: Delete the selected saved search from this list.

Guide.title: Quick Start Guide
Guide.html: This PDF document contains a thorough and visual help guide with diagrams explaining all of the features of this application. You can refer to this document at any time, or download it, or print it.

Guide.title: Training Courses
Guide.html: Learn how to get the most from this application and associated products and services. There are three courses, designed for specific groups of users. Each course of comprised of a number of lessons which take the form of multimedia videos showing how to use the system.

Guide.title: Recruiter
Guide.html: This is the list of all grouped lessons for the recruiter training course designed specifically for recruitment consultants.

Guide.title: Administrator
Guide.html: This is the list of all grouped lessons for the adminisrator training course designed specifically for system administrators, power users, or IT specialists.

Guide.title: Developer
Guide.html: This is the list of all grouped lessons for the developer training course designed specifically for software developers, programmers or web designers.

Guide.title: Course Progress
Guide.html: This status bar shows the percentage of the course which has been completed.

Guide.title: Course Lessons and Time
Guide.html: Thus button shows the number of lessons in the course and the total time to complete the course. Pressing this button shows the course outline in a popup window.

Guide.title: Lesson Name
Guide.html: Each course lesson has a name which is a hyperlink which when clicked, opens the video describing the specified feature.

Guide.title: Start/Play
Guide.html: If the course lesson has not been viewed, this button will show 'Start', else it will show a green tick indicating that the lesson has been completed.

Guide.title: Status/History
Guide.html: Show the number of course lessons completed by the logged in user

Guide.title: Training Course Summary
Guide.html: These training courses are a very good starting point when using a powerful web based recruitment for the first time. The courses are best enjoyed with your sound turned on, with each video running full-screen.

Guide.title: App Store
Guide.html: This page contains a series of links to TriSys products and services including third party products and services designed to work with, and add value to TriSys.

Guide.title: Microsoft Office
Guide.html: The TriSys office add-in allows you to easily view e-mail sender/recipient information and import valuable data into your recruitment database.

Guide.title: Browser Extensions
Guide.html: TriSys can be installed into your web browser to allow you to view and link social network profiles directly into your database. This saves you time and increases the accuracy and relevance of your recruitment database.

Guide.title: Web Portals
Guide.html: You can build and host your entire website with us, and your live vacancies can be exposed to candidates through a powerful jobs portal allowing them to apply, register, maintain favourites and enter timesheets.

Guide.title: Mobile Apps
Guide.html: The TriSys Mobile application is available in both Apple and Google app stores and allows access to your recruitment data on the move.

Guide.title: Web API
Guide.html: Our web technology can be programmed by web designers to build fully interactive web sites, mobile apps and web applications. The Web API provides a data manipulation layer with full CRUD capabilities and security built in.

Guide.title: Job Broadcasting
Guide.html: You can send your live jobs into multiple job boards by using our job broadcasting partner network.

Guide.title: SMS Text Messaging
Guide.html: You can send text messages directly via TriSys actions. Our partner network can deliver these messages to any mobile phone network.

Guide.title: Social Networks
Guide.html: You can upload jobs to the most popular social networks to drive candidates to your web jobs pages and have automated shortlisting saving you valuable time and money.

Guide.title: Cloud Hosted E-Mail
Guide.html: TriSys is fully compatible with the most popular cloud hosted business e-mail services such as those from Google and Microsoft.

Guide.title: Your TriSys User Options
Guide.html:
This area allows you to manage your user options. Please take a moment to review each option and set your preferences.

For your convenience, any changes made here are automatically saved.

Click 'Next' to start a visual overview of your TriSys User Options.

Guide.title: Forms Behaviour
Guide.html:
Enable/Disable automatic dashboard loading after logging in', configure colour themes, font preferences, visual page styles and more.

It is also recommended that you enable the option 'Append Record ID to Caption'.

Guide.title: Login Security and Synchronisation with E-Mail and Diary Services
Guide.html:
Login security

Manage your login preferences including two-factor authentication.


E-Mail and Diary Synchronisation instructions:

Enable two-way modern synchronisation of e-mails and diary activities between TriSys and your e-mail service provider.

Simply scroll down until you see 'Cloud Sync' and then enable Cloud Sync and click the 'Authorise' button, authenticate with your E-Mail account username and password and then after successful authorisation confirmation, select whether you wish to enable E-Mail synchronisation and Diary synchronisation or either.

Should you not see 'Cloud Sync' when you scroll down in this tab, please ask your TriSys database administrator to make the Cloud Sync configuration visible for your user login.

Guide.title: App Settings
Guide.html: This is mainly technical information about your account, there is no need for you to consider this area of the system.

Guide.title: Grid Management
Guide.html:
To maximise performance, you may wish to turn on Limit Grid Rows and set the Maximum Rows to a sensible number.
You can also set the grid page size which will allow for faster data retrieval for large data sets.

Your grid configuration will conveniently apply on all devices where you login to TriSys.

Use the 'Reset' button below to remove your own custom grid layouts and revert to the standard grid layout (this will only apply to your user account and not affect other users).

Please note: each data grid also allows you to set Records per Page, enable/disable grid grouping and more.

Grid grouping allows data grouping based on selected fields in grids.

Grid paging allows viewing grid paging controls either at top, bottom or both top and bottom of grids.

Guide.title: E-Mail
Guide.html:
You can set the defaults for your e-mail send outs.
If you are sending e-mail directly without using Outlook, you will need to enter your technical SMTP settings into the fields below.

Guide.title: Telephone (CRM VoIP Integration)
Guide.html: Choose your VoIP provider/application (should you already be using a VoIP solution you must ensure that this VoIP solution is running on your computer/device as a web browser extension or application which will detect when you click a telephone number in TriSys and capture this click in order to establish a call).

Guide.title: Recruitment Defaults
Guide.html:
You should set your initials into the respective Requirement Prefix and Placement Prefix fields so that automatically generated references are easily identified as yours when advertised online.
If you have an iProfile account, enter these details here.

Guide.title: Job Posting
Guide.html:
If you have a job broadcasting account with either Broadbean or LogicMelon, please enter then here. You will need one of these accounts if you wish to upload vacancies to job boards.
If you wish to post vacancies to social networks, you will need a buffer account. Enter your buffer e-mail address here.
You should also enter your social network URL's so that TriSys can automatically load the post in a web browser tab.

Guide.title: TriSys Administration Area
Guide.html:
Please Note: you are fully responsible for any changes made to your TriSys database using the Administration Console.

As an administrator user, you have unrestricted control over the system and we always advise you to seek training and/or consultancy should you wish to learn more about the deeper configuration capabilities of TriSys Recruitment Software.

Thank You.

Guide.title: User Maintenance
Guide.html:
Manage user accounts, track user account expiry/renewal dates, add new user accounts and more, all done using a self-service approach to user management.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: User Groups
Guide.html:
Users can be grouped into whatever grouping names you require such as department, location or specialisation. Groups and users are depicted as a tree.

Users can belong to multiple groups, but must belong to at least one group.

Use the toolbar buttons as follows:

Edit Group: Edit the selected group name
Add Group: Add a new group
Remove Group: Remove the selected group
Add User: Add an existing user to the selected group
Remove User(s): Remove one or more selected users from the selected group

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: Performance Targets
Guide.html:
Users can be assigned performance targets such as number of CV's to send, or placement fees on a daily, weekly, monthly or annual basis. View the targets by name or by user and maintain target metrics and target values. Multiple targets per user can be defined and these can vary over time i.e. targets are often lower for new starters and increase over time.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk

Guide.title: Attributes/Lookups
Guide.html:
The TriSys database application comprises many lookup fields and attributes/skills ranging from job titles, task types through to industries and CRB checking. This master/detail view is how they are maintained.

The various Categories are displayed on the left and for each category, a list of matching Attributes/Lookups will be displayed in the grid on the right.

Use the provided buttons to manage Categories shown on the left and also Attributes/Lookups shown on the right:

Add Category:Add a new category
Edit Category:Edit the selected category
Remove Category:Remove the selected category
Add Attribute:Add a new attribute to the selected category
Edit Attribute:Edit the selected attribute
Remove Attribute:Remove the selected attribute

WARNING: You should only modify anything in this area under supervision from TriSys' technical support.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: System Settings
Guide.html:
The database application comprises many system settings to allow customised operational behaviour. This grid shows all system settings which can be changed. Use the toolbar to manage these:

Add:Add a new system setting
Edit:Edit the selected system setting
Remove:Remove the selected system setting

WARNING: You should only modify system settings under supervision from TriSys' technical support.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: User Settings
Guide.html:
Centrally manage an extensive range of technical configuration parameters on a per-user basis.

WARNING: You should only modify anything in this area under supervision from TriSys' technical support.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: Field Descriptions
Guide.html:
The TriSys database application comprises hundreds of data fields. This area is used by TriSys to manage field relationships, field properties and much more.

WARNING: You should only modify anything in this area under supervision from TriSys' technical support.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: Document Manager
Guide.html:
The document manager allows you to maintain the list of documents, master templates and attachments available for Mail Merges (and other automated workflows) in TriSys.

This area is where such centralised documents are maintained.

The folders on the left will contain specific documents. Click any folder to display its contents. . You can easily add documents to existing folders by dragging the document into the documents grid (or using the 'Add Document' button.

Use the toolbar buttons to manage your documents:

Add Document:Add a document to the selected folder
Remove Document(s):Remove one or more selected documents

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: Invalid CV Paths
Guide.html:
Over the course of many years, as database applications get upgraded and migrated between numerous versions and server infrastructures, some CV's may no longer exist on the expected location i.e. 'CV goes missing'.

The 'Invalid CV Paths' tool automatically finds all missing CV's and displays the affected candidate records, allowing you to update the Candidate CV.

IMPORTANT: usage of the Administration Console is at your own risk.

Guide.title: User Security Permissions Management
Guide.html:
Select a user on the left:



Then specify which area of the application you would like to configure security permissions for:



Once done, you can use the 'Copy' button to copy the security profile of the selected user, then click any other user name and 'Paste' the security profile onto that user and repeat for as many users as required.

Security permissions will auto-save when edited.

Users will have the security permissions updated when they next login.

Guide.title: Post-It Note
Guide.html:
The post-it note popup window is designed to work like a paper note. It is typically used when you wish to quickly notify one or more of your colleagues such as when they receive a phone call but are unable to take it. You specify the recipient(s) of the post-it note and type a message, then use the Send button. The message will immediately appear on the recipients application.
When you receive post-it notes, you can snooze, clear, hide or reply.

Guide.title: Automated General Data Protection Regulation Monitoring
Guide.html:
This area will display all the contact records on your TriSys database who have specified their GDPR preferences through the optionally available TriSys Candidate and Client web portals.

You can restrict usage of this area by configuring user permissions through the 'TriSys Administration Console > Security' area.

Guide.title: Step 1 - Download Data Import Template (Excel File)
Guide.html:
Please download the TriSys Data Import Excel template file.

Then place your existing data within the provided template file, ensuring you do not change the file structure in any way (simply follow the instructions provided within the file)

Guide.title: Step 2 - Upload Data (Excel File)
Guide.html:
Automatically populate your TriSys database with Candidates, Clients and Companies by uploading a correctly formatted Excel file.

WARNING: never upload data without firstly asking your TriSys account manager or TriSys Support team to validate the format of the data. Not doing so may lead to an incorrect import which will require paid consultancy services for subsequent cleansing.

Guide.title: TriSys File Manager
Guide.html:
Upload your business files and store your business data within your TriSys Cloud File Manager. Your data is backed up daily.

The existing folders and files shown here are an integral part of your TriSys service, please do not change these in any way, however feel free to add new folders and store documents within.

You may also preview and edit documents and, in the case of Word and Excel files, these can be edited directly inside TriSys.

You can restrict usage of this area by configuring user permissions through the 'TriSys Administration Console > Security' tab.

Guide.title: Security Functionalities
Guide.html:
1. Management Server / Company Desktop / Dev VM Firewall Access: Allow your IP address through the AWS firewall.

2. Start Your Virtual Machine: start your TriSys company desktop instance.

3. Access to Smart-Client Test Builds: allow your IP to receive pre-release/test SmartClient automatic updates.

4. Remote Server Connectivity Testing: test that production TriSys Web API can connect to customers' on-premise SQL+NAS Servers.

5. Apex Subscribers: Log one or all users off if necessary for planned maintenance reasons. Message broadcasting to all users is also possible.

6. OAuth + MFA: Introduced as part of Microsoft's deprecation of Basic Authentication, allowing running tests.

Guide.title: Snooze Post-It Note/Task Alarm
Guide.html: You can temporarily hide the post-it note or task alarm popup windows for any length of time or until a designated date and time. This is useful if you wish to delay a piece of work, or wish to be constantly reminded of something important.

Guide.title: Task Alarms
Guide.html:
TriSys will generate alarms for scheduled tasks when running actions. These are known as follow-ups. Over time, these can build up and it is beneficial to keep on top of your follow-ups to ensure that good business practice is being followed.
This grid contains the list of all your outstanding follow-ups which have not yet been cleared. Use the Open button to open the task popup containing information about who/what/when.
You can also use the toolbar buttons:

Open: Open the selected task
Snooze: Delay the alarm notification
Clear Alarm: Clear the alarm for the selected task(s)
Clear Task: Clear the task and alarm

Guide.title: Live Requirements
Guide.html: This is a list of all your current live/active requirements displayed in a grid. Use the Open button to open the requirement record.

Guide.title: Contractors Working
Guide.html: This is a list of all your contractors and temp who are currently working. Use the Open button to open the placement record.

Guide.title: Interviews
Guide.html: This is a list of all your upcoming candidate interviews over the next seven days. Use the Open button to open the task record from where you can open the requirement, candidate or client details.

Guide.title: Starters
Guide.html: This is a list of all your upcoming candidate placement starts over the next seven days. Use the Open button to open the placement record from where you can open the candidate or client details.

Guide.title: Finishers
Guide.html: This is a list of all your upcoming candidate placement completions over the next two weeks days. Use the Open button to open the placement record from where you can open the candidate or client details.

Guide.title: Logoff TriSys
Guide.html: If you wish to log off the application and in so doing remove your cookies preventing future automatic login, then please click Yes, else click No.

Guide.title: About TriSys
Guide.html: This is confirmation of the application, version numbers, copyright, licensee information, and cloud resources. Please click Visit Us to open our web site, or click Terms & Conditions to open the terms and conditions of service, or click OK to close the popup.

Guide.title: TriSys Subscription
Guide.html: You can subscribe to this service using this popup window by confirming your personal and company details.

Guide.title: Agree to Terms & Conditions
Guide.html: You must agree to our terms and conditions.

Guide.title: Post Code Lookup
Guide.html: You can enter a partial or full post code and use this button to choose a matching address.

Guide.title: Subscribe
Guide.html:
This will validate your details, and submit these to our cloud infrastructure provisioning system. You will receive an automated e-mail confirming your subscription.
Your own personalised database, files, applications, logins and security systems will be provisioned over the subsequent minutes.
Once this is complete, you will receive an automated e-mail confirming the provisioning and allowing you access.

Guide.title: TriSys Terms & Conditions
Guide.html: These are the terms and conditions of this service. You must agree to these upon registration and the addition of new user accounts.

Guide.title: Welcome Wizard
Guide.html:
This is an 8 step wizard designed to capture all essential information from you in order for the application to work efficiently.
Information such as your photo, company logo and contact details will ensure that the mail merges work correctly.
The job prefixes will ensure that your generated requirement and placement references are easily identified.
Your SMTP details will ensure that automated e-mails are delivered from you.
Social network settings will allow you to post jobs to social media.

Use the Previous and Next buttons to navigate through the wizard and the Finish button once all stages have been completed.

Guide.title: Scheduled Task & Note/History
Guide.html:
The task popup allows you to edit or create new tasks linked to one or more clients or candidates or users.
Each task has a type and a start date/time and end date/time.
Tasks can be scheduled and alarmed so that they appear on your diary.

Guide.title: Task Type
Guide.html: Task types indicate the manner in which the task is to be dealt with for example telephone calls, e-mails, meetings etc.. Task types can be configured in the administrator console. You must choose a single task type.

Guide.title: Start Date / Time
Guide.html: The date and time that this task starts. If this is an all day task, only the date is required.

Guide.title: End Date / Time
Guide.html: The date and time that this task ends. If this is an all day task, only the date is required.

Guide.title: Scheduled
Guide.html:
When a task is scheduled, it will appear in the diary of all users included in the Users tab, and appear on the Scheduled Tasks grid on linked forms.
If a task is not scheduled, it will not appear in users' diaries and is considered a 'Note/History' and will appear in the Notes/History grids on linked forms.

Guide.title: All Day Task
Guide.html: When this is checked, the start/end date fields allow only dates to be selected. When not checked, times must be entered into the start/end dates fields.

Guide.title: Task Tabs
Guide.html: The tabs group the important aspects of the task together in a convenient place.

Guide.title: Description
Guide.html: This tab shows the text of the task - the description. Most of the time, this will be automatically generated for you by the actions subsystem.

Guide.title: Alarm
Guide.html: This tab allows an alarm to be set for this task, together with a Lead Time which is the amount of time to show the alarm before the start date.

Guide.title: Contacts
Guide.html: This tab allows you to add, open and delete contacts to/from this task grid using the File menu button. This task will appear on the respective contacts Scheduled Tasks or Note/History grids.

Guide.title: Users
Guide.html: This tab allows you to add and delete users to/from this task grid using the File menu button. If a scheduled task, then it will appear on the respective users' diary, and optionally popup an alert if alarmed.

Guide.title: Attachment
Guide.html: This tab allows you to add or delete an attachment to this task. Use the magnifying glass button to choose a file, or the folder button to open it or the cross button to delete it. You can also enter a description of the attachment beneath the file.

Guide.title: Links
Guide.html: This tab allows you to link, open and unlink entities (requirement, placement, timesheet) to/from this task grid using the File menu button. This task will appear on the respective entity record Scheduled Tasks or Note/History grids.

Guide.title: Attributes
Guide.html: This tab allows you to add and remove attributes/skills to/from this task using the Add and Remove buttons respectively. This task can then be easily searched and found.

Guide.title: Requirement Pay/Charge Rate(s)
Guide.html: This is where you add or edit both pay and charge rates. A pay rate is what you pay the candidate. A charge rate is what the client pays you for the provision of this candidate.

Guide.title: Rate Type
Guide.html:
Choose a rate type from the drop down list. The Standard rate type normally covers normal working hours (e.g. 9:00am to 5:30pm). Their may also be overtime rates to cover evenings, weekends and bank holidays.
The list of rate types can be managed from the administrator console.

Guide.title: Rate Notes
Guide.html: The notes will are pre-defined and will reflect what is selected in the rate type. You may override this to specify rate specific notes such as the times covered during the shift.

Guide.title: Pay Rate
Guide.html:
The pay rate is what is paid to the candidate. It comprises the currency, amount and period.
The currency can be any local or international/foreign currency.
The period can be hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, annually or anything else you require.
An example of a pay rate could be £30.00 per Hour.
Both the currencies and periods can be managed from the administrator console.

Guide.title: Charge Rate
Guide.html:
The charge rate is what the client is charged for the provision of the candidate. It comprises the currency, amount and period.
The currency can be any local or international/foreign currency.
The period can be hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, annually or anything else you require.
An example of a charge rate could be £235.00 per Day.
Both the currencies and periods can be managed from the administrator console.

Guide.title: Margin/Markup Calculation
Guide.html: Both the margin and markup can be calculated when this is checked. These figures are calculated automatically when either the pay or charge rates are changed. These are shown in the upper right corner of this popup dialogue.

Guide.title: Multiplier / Standard Pay & Charge Rates
Guide.html: If the selected rate type is not Standard, then you will have the option of setting a multiplier to set both the pay and charge rates to be a multiple of the standard rates:

Guide.title: Margin/Markup Percentages
Guide.html: When this is checked, the charge rate is changed when the margin or changed.

Guide.title: Placement Values
Guide.html:
If the selected rate type is Standard, then you will have the option of setting the schedule for the entire placement.

Days per Week: The number of days the candidate will work each week e.g. 5
Hours per Day: the number of hours worked in a standard day e.g. 7.5
Duration (Weeks): the number of weeks that this assignment will last e.g. 13
Value: the total value of the assignment i.e. the total charge
Total Profit: the total pay amount deducted from the total charge amount
Profiet per Unit: the difference between the charge and pay rate for the same period e.g. hour, day etc..

Guide.title: Add New
Guide.html: Save the current rate and create a new one ready to be specified.

Guide.title: Apply
Guide.html: Save the current rate and close this form, updating the underlying rates grid on the form.

Guide.title: Cancel
Guide.html: Cancel all changes and close this form.

Guide.title: Company Pay/Charge Rate(s)
Guide.html:
This is where you add or edit both pay and charge rates for each job title at each company address.
It is therefore a company specific rate card which allows you to allocate rates for specific job titles and specific addresses at this company.
A pay rate is what you pay the candidate. A charge rate is what the client pays you for the provision of this candidate.

Guide.title: Job Title
Guide.html:
Choose any job title by typing and pressing <Return> or by using the magnifying glass button to lookup matches.
The list of job titles can be managed from the administrator console.

Guide.title: Company Address
Guide.html:
Choose an existing company address.
Company addresses can be managed from Contacts/Addresses tab on the company form.

Guide.title: Rate Type
Guide.html:
Choose a rate type from the drop down list. The Standard rate type normally covers normal working hours (e.g. 9:00am to 5:30pm). Their may also be overtime rates to cover evenings, weekends and bank holidays.
The list of rate types can be managed from the administrator console.

Both the currencies and periods can be managed from the administrator console.
