Guide.title: Margin/Markup Percentages
Guide.html: When this is checked, the charge rate is changed when the margin or changed.

Guide.title: Add New
Guide.html: Save the current rate and create a new one ready to be specified.

Guide.title: Apply
Guide.html: Save the current rate, close this form, updating the rates grid on the company form.

Guide.title: Cancel
Guide.html: Cancel all changes and close this form.

Guide.title: Action: Call
Guide.html: Make a phone call to a contact and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against the current record. A call can have a number of attributes added to it to help searching, reporting and business intelligence.

Guide.title: Action: CV Send
Guide.html: Send one or more candidate CV's to a client and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement. The attached CV can be merged from any CV field using any coversheet and sent by e-mail.

Guide.title: Action: Interested
Guide.html: Record that a candidate is interested in a requirement/vacancy, send a confirmation e-mail, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Interview
Guide.html: Schedule an interview between a candidate and client for a requirement/vacancy, send a confirmation e-mail to both with full attendance instructions, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Mail-Merge
Guide.html:
Merge data using modern data-driven e-mail templates allowing you to send personalised e-mails, record a note/history and enable automated diary follow ups.

IMPORTANT: Only choose 'Outlook E-Mail' when you wish to send a mail merge to NO MORE than 4 recipient contacts as web browsers will normally block more than 4 concurrent e-mail message file downloads. Therefore please use 'SMTP' instead of 'Outlook E-Mail' when the total number of recipient contacts is higher than 4.

Use '' Use 'Send to all recipients as blind copy (Bcc) should you wish to send one single message where all recipients are invisible i.e. added to the 'Bcc' field of the email.

ATTENTION: when sending as BCC you will NOT be able to personalise the email for every recipient since BCC only sends one single e-mail!

Guide.title: Action: Meeting
Guide.html: Schedule a meeting with one or more contacts, send a confirmation e-mail to both with full attendance instructions, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Note
Guide.html: Record a note, and optional follow-up, which will be linked against the current record. A note can have a number of attributes added to it to help searching, reporting and business intelligence.

Guide.title: Action: Offer
Guide.html: Merge an offer letter, send it as an e-mail to the candidate, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Offer Accepted
Guide.html: Merge an offer accepted letter, send it as an e-mail to the candidate, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Offer Rejected
Guide.html: Merge an offer rejected letter, send it as an e-mail to the client, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Placement
Guide.html: Convert a shortlisted candidate into a placement, open the placement record, and record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Placement Documentation
Guide.html: Merge placement contracts and engagement letters, send as e-mail, record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Reject
Guide.html: Mark a shortlisted candidate as rejected, merge an e-mail confirmation, record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: E-Mail
Guide.html: Send an ad-hoc e-mail directly to a contact, record a note, and optional follow-up, which will be linked against the current record.

Guide.title: Action: Send Job Specification
Guide.html: Send a job specification document to a candidate by e-mail, record a note, and optional follow-up, which will be linked against the current record.

Guide.title: Action: Send SMS Text Message
Guide.html: Send a text message, record a note, and optional follow-up, which will be linked against the current record.

Guide.title: Action: ToDo
Guide.html: Record a diarised follow-up, which will be linked against the current record. A ToDo can have a number of attributes added to it to help searching, reporting and business intelligence.

Guide.title: Action: Upload Requirement
Guide.html: Send a job to social networks or job boards, create a note, a follow-up, and linked against the current requirement.

Guide.title: Action: Withdrawn
Guide.html: Mark a shortlisted candidate as withdrawn, merge an e-mail confirmation, record a note/history, plus an optional follow-up, which will be linked against all contact records and optionally the current requirement.

Guide.title: New Company Contact
Guide.html: You can create a new company contact using this popup window.

Guide.title: Work Address
Guide.html: Choose an existing company address. You can add additional company addresses from the Contacts/Addresses tab on the company form.

Guide.title: Edit New Contact on Save
Guide.html: Check this if you wish to open the contact record for editing immediately after saving the new contact.

Guide.title: Save
Guide.html: Save the new contact record, updating the underlying company record with a new company contact.

Guide.title: New Company Address
Guide.html: You can create a new company address using this popup window.

Guide.title: Address Type
Guide.html: Choose from the list of available address types: Head Office, Branch or Invoice.

Guide.title: Post Code
Guide.html: Enter a full or partial post code to lookup a matching address and pre-fill the company address fields.

Guide.title: Save
Guide.html: Save the address record, updating the underlying company record and refreshing the grid.

Guide.title: Edit Company Address
Guide.html: You can edit an existing company address using this popup window.

Guide.title: Address Type
Guide.html: Choose from the list of available address types: Head Office, Branch or Invoice.

Guide.title: Post Code
Guide.html: Enter a full or partial post code to lookup a matching address and pre-fill the company address fields.

Guide.title: Save
Guide.html: Save the address record, updating the underlying company record and refreshing the grid.

Guide.title: New Company
Guide.html: You can create a new company record and a new address using this popup window.

Guide.title: Company Name
Guide.html: Enter the company name here. This must be unique, otherwise validation will fail.

Guide.title: Address Type
Guide.html: Choose from the list of available address types: Head Office, Branch or Invoice.

Guide.title: Post Code
Guide.html: Enter a full or partial post code to lookup a matching address and pre-fill the company address fields.

Guide.title: Edit New Company on Save
Guide.html: Check this if you wish to open the company record for editing immediately after saving the new company.

Guide.title: Save
Guide.html: Save the new company record, updating the underlying contact record with a new company and address.

Guide.title: Developer Studio
Guide.html: You have been granted access to the developer studio which allows you to customise this application.

Guide.title: Folders/Files
htmlList: The folders/files list shows all of your company's customisation folders containing javascript, html and JSON files.
Apex - This application and Web Jobs customisation files
Generix - Our generic web application SDK for building web sites for any industry
Platformix - Our content management system for building engaging web sites
TriOnyx - Our latest mobile app SDK for building compelling business apps
Vertex - Our mobile suite of applications for building custom mobile apps

Guide.title: Folder Menu
htmlList: This menu contains the following options:
New Folder - create a new sub folder beneath the currently selected folder
Rename Folder - assign a new name to the currently selected folder
New Folder - remove the currently selected folder and all files and folders beneath

Guide.title: File Menu
htmlList: This menu contains options to manage your files
HTML - a hypertext markup language file which is the presentation of your form
Javascript - a programming language to build business logic and read/write data
Customer Module - build your own post-login logic
Navigation Bar - specify the grouping on the left
Paired - generate two files which work in tandem as a form

Guide.title: Save
Guide.html: Save the currently open file.

Guide.title: Save All
Guide.html: Saves all open files.

Guide.title: Close
Guide.html: Closes the form without saving any open files.

Guide.title: Developer Studio Summary
htmlList: If you are a competent web developer, these capabilities give you unlimited power to build any type of business application for any type of device.

Guide.title: App Studio
htmlList: You have been granted access to the app studio which allows you to customise this application
using the no-code and low-code tools built into this application.

Guide.title: Management Reports
Guide.html:
An extensive range of reports is available with your TriSys database, allowing you to monitor KPI's across a range of different areas.

Simply select a report or report category and click 'Run' to load the report (you may also export any report to Microsoft Excel).

Guide.title: Report Category
Guide.html: All reports are available, but you can also choose to list reports by category.

Guide.title: Report Name & Description
Guide.html: The report grid lists the available reports (including any custom reports created specifically for your business).

Guide.title: All Marketing Campaigns
Guide.html:
For customers who have subscribed to the TriSys Marketing module, this area allows sending mass mails to your contact database and also automatically track delivery/read/open/clicks.

You may select one or more users from the 'User(s)' list above in order to display campaigns created/managed by other TriSys users in your organisation.

You can restrict usage of this area by configuring user permissions through the 'TriSys Administration Console > Security' tab.

Guide.title: Add New Campaign
Guide.html: Start here in order to add a new campaign. Please note the Campaign module should only be used by TriSys Customers who have subscribed to this module. Alternatively you may use the 'Mail Merge' action which is available in all other areas of your TriSys database.

Guide.title: Clone Existing Campaign
Guide.html: Repeat a campaign, whilst preserving the original campaign delivery/open/read/click metrics (recommended).

Guide.title: Edit/Open Selected Campaign
Guide.html: Select a previously created campaign and click this button in order to edit the campaign configuration. Alternatively simply click the 'Open' button next to each campaign shown below

Guide.title: Delete Campaign
Guide.html: This button deletes a selected e-mail campaign (all analytics for the deleted campaign will be permanently removed).

Guide.title: Show Help
htmlList: The integrated Help system is always available to assist you in getting the best from TriSys.
Simply click this button and the contextual Help system will guide you through the functionality of the current form.
You can also enable Help by pressing the F1 key on your keyboard.

Guide.title: Contact Preview
htmlList: This is the editable contact preview window, displayed when you click the (spyglass) icon on a contact grid or contact record.
The contact preview allows you to preview and edit contact details, preview CV's (with automatic keyword highlighting) preview Requirements, Placements, Notes and Tasks for any contact.
